newsitem.title: UK: CYCLING-WEARY RIIS WITHDRAWS FROM WORLD CUP RACE.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-WEARY RIIS WITHDRAWS FROM WORLD CUP RACE.

text.p: A weary Bjarne Riis, last year's Tour de France winner, has withdrawn from Sunday's World Cup race, the Rochester Classic.
"He has a stomach upset, and he is still tired from the Tour de France," team manager Frans van Looy said on Saturday.

The Dane, who had already pulled out of next month's Vuelta a Espana, said he needed more time to recover from a particularly hard Tour this year when he fell back in the later stages and finished almost half an hour behind winner Jan Ullrich of Germany.
A record 152-strong line-up, among them World Cup leader Rolf Sorensen of Denmark, are due to take part in Sunday's 242.3 kms race.
